alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 16 at 9:54AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER DOWNSTREAM OF KALSKAG TO KWETHLUK... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is possible. * WHERE...The Kuskokwim River downstream of Kalskag to Kwethluk. * WHEN...Through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...The breakup front on the Kuskokwim is progressing steadily downstream past Kalskag. Heavy runs of bank to bank ice have been reported at Kalskag beginning late Monday night with water levels rising as the front pushes through causing flooding of low lying areas. The breakup front is expected to reach Tuluksak, Akiak, Akiachak, and Kwethluk by the end of the day Tuesday. Water levels will rise as the breakup front passes and potentially flood low lying areas. In place sheet ice was observed by the River Watch team yesterday from below Kalskag down to Bethel. The ice was weaker and more deteriorated so the threat of an ice jam is lower but the potential still exists for ice jam related flooding in these communities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Ice jam flooding has high uncertainty. Impacts could range between localized high water and severe flooding. Now is the time to take precautions. Where possible, move items to higher ground and prepare your community for possible flooding. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - Please stay tuned to weather.gov/Anchorage, NOAA weather radio or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
